Arrow: Right. Let's go and steal one, then?

Arrow runs from the building.
=

Deemos: After you.

Arrow walks back in.

Arrow: Sorry, got over anxious..=
.

  ----- Original Message -----
  From: RoboRick007
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogro=
ups.com
  Sent: Monday, August 12, 2002 3:13 PM
  Subject: Re: Secret Messa=
ges


  : : Diesel : :

  Diesel nods, greeting Deemos. But he quickly turn=
s to buisness.

  Diesel: We should leave quickly. If the Maximal governmen=
t decodes the message they will be on us in a nano click. The Tripredacus C=
ouncil probably wont be happy either. We should pack some equipment and get=
 the ship within the next few hours.
    ----- Original Message ----- 
    =
From: Iron Man Lives Again! 
    To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
    Sent: Mond=
ay, August 12, 2002 2:48 AM
    Subject: Re: Secret Messages


    Arrow: Y=
eah. I know where we can "get" a ship.

    Shortly thereafter, Deemos push=
ed the doors open with a loud thud. He walks in slowly and walked right up =
to Arrow's face.

    Deemos: Remember we made a truce last time we met.

 =
   Arrow: Yeah. You killed Perplex anyway.

    Deemos smiled.

    Deemos:=
 It was a very good old friend of mine who killed Perplex.

    Arrow: I ki=
lled the kid.

    Deemos: Oh?

    Arrow: The male. Ripped the spark out o=
f his chest.

    Deemos: I underestimated you, then.

    Arrow: This is D=
iesel.

    Deemos: Greetings.

    Arrow: Diesel, this is the Deemos. The =
leader of the former group the Chosen Mafia.

    Deemos smiled with the in=
tentions of a demon dreaming, or something like that...

      ----- Origin=
al Message -----
      From: RoboRick007
      To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
 =
     Sent: Monday, August 12, 2002 2:35 AM
      Subject: Re: Secret Messag=
es


      : : Diesel : :

      Diesel looks shocked when Deemos' voice co=
mes through the comm.

      Diesel: It did... it worked. I guess now we ju=
st wait for him. Then it's off too Earth!
        ----- Original Message --=
--- 
        From: Iron Man Lives Again! 
        To: nbwrpg@...=
m 
        Sent: Monday, August 12, 2002 1:59 AM
        Subject: Re: Secre=
t Messages


        Arrow: I don't think that'll work, it could be a very =
old listing.

        (Meanwhile)

        Deemos (thinking): If someone wa=
nts to contact me, they'd probably look up my old number.

        He types=
 his old number into his commlink and waits.

        (Meanwhile)

        =
Arrow dials the number.

        Deemos over comm unit: Hello. No time to w=
aste, location.

        Arrow reads off the address of the place. Since th=
at it was so secret, I won't tell it here. (I don't know it)

        Arrow=
: It worked...

          ----- Original Message -----
          From: Robo=
Rick007
          To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
          Sent: Monday, August=
 12, 2002 1:28 AM
          Subject: Re: Secret Messages


          : : Di=
esel : :

          Diesel tries to think of a way to reach Deemos. He fina=
lly comes up with something, but a long shot.

          Diesel: Well I wou=
ldn't know. We can try the listings for his comm channel. A bot like him pr=
obably isn't listed, but it's all I can think to do.

          Diesel sits=
 at a computer and starts to search through records. After about ten minute=
s he comes up with it. He stands back from the comp.

          Diesel: Wel=
l I'll be a Sharkticon, here it is. Try this channel.

          He points =
to the list on the screen.
            ----- Original Message ----- 
      =
      From: Iron Man Lives Again! 
            To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
=
            Sent: Monday, August 12, 2002 1:14 AM
            Subject: Re: =
Secret Messages


            Arrow: The message sent asked for another per=
son. whom I recognize. His name is Deemos, and he used to be both an ally a=
nd an enemy of mine at different times. He's deadly, but so are we.

      =
      He crosses his arms.

            Arrow: I used to know alot of other=
s, but I broke off from them a bit back. The one named Airbomber got very j=
ealous of me. He was only greedy and an egomaniac, however. Where could we =
find Deemos? I've long since forgotten his signal...

              ----- O=
riginal Message -----
              From: RoboRick007
              To: nbw=
rpg@yahoogroups.com
              Sent: Monday, August 12, 2002 12:56 AM
  =
            Subject: Re: Secret Messages


              : : Diesel : :

  =
            He looked at Arrow. He eyes flashed and gave a very evil sense.=
 You knew that he had a maniacle smile under his faceplate.

              =
Diesel: You know it. However we should take care of some things here first.=
 If we go to join Razor, we may need more men. Know of anyone?
            =
    ----- Original Message ----- 
                From: Degenerate 
       =
         To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
                Sent: Monday, August 1=
2, 2002 12:39 AM
                Subject: Re: Secret Messages


           =
     OOC: If I can be serious for a minute, this group is the epitome of se=
riousness and does not deserve to be subjected to a silly post. Prepare for=
 the rebirth of the original rookie monster of NBW.

                BIC:

=
                Arrow hears Diesel's voice. His back was turned to his old =
ally. He tries to remember where he had seen Diesel before. Memories of his=
 past come flying back to him. They return easily when he needs them enough=
, he finds, the Radicons hadn't done a very good job of erasing these memor=
ies. He slowly turns around, recalling Diesel's place in his tumultuous lif=
e.

                Arrow: Ah, yes, Diesel, the message. It has been a long=
 time, hasn't it? Shall we get to business immediately?

                Ar=
row could barely remember Razor. He didn't hold anything against the Radico=
ns for damaging his memory so badly. They did what they had to, Arrow had a=
ttempted to kill them.

                Arrow: So, what now? Do we head to =
Earth?
                ~~~~~
                Deemos was sitting in a meetin=
g, bored.

                Leader: Gentlemen, we must all band together and=
 stop this menace! We cannot allow this other club to gain the upper hand! =
We truly have the best flag! The others will pay for their disagreeance!

 =
               Deemos: What kind of club is this? And is disagreeance a wor=
d?

                Leader: This is not a club, this is a council. It's the=
 Council of Evil. And yes, Disagreeance is a word.

                Deemos:=
 No, you said "We cannot allow this other club to gain the upper hand," app=
arently if there is this "other" club, this is a club.

                Lea=
der: See here--

                Deemos: I was the one who held a council. =
We were the Mafia, the most imposing group to ever exist save for the Allia=
nce.

                Leader: Sir, I'm certain I don't know what you are ta=
lking about.

                Deemos: If this so called council is so evil,=
 why is it that we are not attacking, and why is it that we are not spillin=
g blood.

                Leader: Mech fluid.

                Deemos: It's=
 the same thing. I've spilled alot of it.

                Leader: Well, si=
r, you see, we like to bide our time, and then--

                Deemos: T=
hen you burn someone else's flag. Then they come and burn yours. You don't =
know what violence is. I am the epitome of violence. The innovator. The onl=
y individuals I've seen you destroy are your own comrades. Not that it's a =
bad thing to destroy your comrades, I've destroyed plenty of lackeys in my =
time.

                Leader: I think you're only saying this because you'=
ve joined another council! I think you need to be dealt with! You're nothin=
g more than a vicious traitor!

                Deemos: So you guys are goi=
ng to deal with me? Put me away? Send me to the great junkyard in the sky?
=

                Member: Junkyard?

                Leader: Enough of this,=
 get him!

                Deemos stands up. A member sitting right next to=
 him stands up as well, but he's too slow and too dumb. Deemos puts a pisto=
l to his mid section quickly and fires. Several bolts rip through the robot=
, creating several flashes and one hole leading all the way through. The un=
lucky one falls to the ground. Deemos' trigger finger quickly flicks a swit=
ch on the utility pistol as he swivels it around towards another member who=
 was raising a rifle. Deemos moves forward a single step and barely dodges =
a shot heading his way. He fires the pistol and a barrage of 5 inch long st=
eel nails are fired at rapid speed, piercing the head of the attackee and t=
earing off large chunks. Deemos quickly spins around, flicking a switch onc=
e more and he fires. Several shots hit the robot who had fired at him, cutt=
ing down the bot who shocked at Deemos' speed and severing one of his arms =
and his head. The cut down fellow's head rolled across the floor as the bod=
y dropped.

                Leader: Idiots!

                Deemos quickly=
 fired a few pellets on the ground, which erupted into tall flames. He was =
hidden from sight. A shot emerges from behind the flames, passing Deemos' h=
ead by inches.

                Leader: Did you hear that? I think I got hi=
m.

                A grenade flies out from behind the fire and rolls near=
 the Leader of the council's feet.

                (Cut to)

             =
   Deemos runs through the halls of the building as a massive explosion eru=
pts behind him, detonating the room he previously occupied. It was no probl=
em escaping from these buffoons, he thought as he exited the building, laug=
hing at the fact that he destroyed about 20 or so more lives. He decided to=
 check his messages. His commlink system was designed to capture messages a=
nd hold them for a later hearing. He had two of these. He activated the fir=
st one.

                Message: Hey, buddy, I got some of those (buzz) we=
re trying to get. It was (buzz) so, you wanna (buzz) we've--

             =
   Deemos deletes the message quickly. A wrong number and a bad commlink. H=
e activates the next message. He listens to the code carefully then plays i=
t back again. He plays it back a third time.

                Deemos: Hmm. =
Maybe. This sounds like the old code.

                He activates his jet=
s and flies, planning to answer this message addressing him and the the one=
 that he knew well back on Earth, Arrow. It had been a long time since he h=
ad come in contact with Razor. He was ready for anything...

              =
    ----- Original Message -----
                  From: RoboRick007
      =
            To: Neo Beast Wars
                  Sent: Sunday, August 11, 2=
002 11:03 PM
                  Subject: Secret Messages


                 =
 : : Diesel : :

                  On Cybertron a fuel tanker truck drives =
down an elevated street, before pulling into what looked like an abandon bu=
ilding. The black and silver truck transformes into a menacing Cybertronian=
. A Decepticon too be exact. He turns to the others in the building.

     =
             Diesel: Hey Arrow, did you pick up that incoded transmission t=
hat came through the Transwarp portal?

                  He awaits a respo=
nse.

                  : : Wolfenstein : :

                  While he fol=
lows Megatron deeper into the base. His comm system picks up a transmission=
. However it is heavily incoded so he cannot listen too it now. He sets his=
 comm unit to work on it, and continues on.

ahoo! Groups is subject to the Yahoo! Terms of Service. 



              Y=
our use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to the Yahoo! Terms of Service. 



   =
         Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to the Yahoo! Terms of Servic=
e. 



          Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to the Yahoo! Terms o=
f Service. 



        Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to the Yahoo! T=
erms of Service. 



      Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to the Yaho=
o! Terms of Service. 



    Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to the Ya=
hoo! Terms of Service. 


        Yahoo! Groups Sponsor 
              ADVE=
RTISEMENT
             
       

  Your use of Yahoo! Groups is subject to =
the Yahoo! Terms of Service.
